required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Absorption and Metabolism of Olive Leaf Extract and Its Effect on Vascular Reactivity and Cytokine Concentrations
clinical_study.official_title: Absorption and Metabolism of Olive Leaf Extract and Its Effect on Vascular Reactivity and Cytokine Concentrations

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine how olive leaf is absorbed and metabolised and also whether it has any effect on the elasticity of blood vessels and the immune system.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine how olive leaf is absorbed and metabolised and also whether it has any effect on vascular function and cytokine concentrations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0. 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8 hours post ingestion (blood) 0, 0-4, 4-8 and 8-24 hours post ingestion (urine)
primary_outcome.description: Olive leaf polyphenol metabolites measured in blood and urine samples

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 2, 4, 6 hours post ingestion (LDI) 0, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6 and 8 hours post ingestion (DVP)
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular function was assessed via two methods: Laser Doppler Iontophoresis (LDI) and Digital Volume Pulse (DVP)
Concentrations of IL-8, IL-1beta, IL-6, IL-10 and TNF-alpha will be measured in whole blood stimulated with LPS.

arm_group.description: Four placebo capsules containing safflower oil only
Four olive leaf capsules. Each containing 4mg oleuropein plus safflower oil.

intervention.description: Four capsules taken at baseline each containing 4mg oleuropein

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 19-40 years, non-smokers, able to swallow capsules, have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18.5-30, have a normal liver function and haematology and a max alcohol intake of <21 units/week
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those who suffer from any form of disease, including endocrine disease, liver disease, diabetes mellitus, myocardial infarction, blood clotting disorder, reproductive disorder, gastrointestinal disease or a chronic gastrointestinal disorder.
- Individuals who are vegetarian, have dietary restrictions or on a weight reducing diet will not be recruited.
- Subjects who have been taking antibiotics in previous 3 months before study will not be included in the study
- Females who may be pregnant, or if of childbearing potential and are not using effective contraceptive precautions will be excluded.
- Blood pressure > 150/90 mmHg
- Haemoglobin < 125 g/l for male, < 110 g/l for female
- Gamma GT (liver enzymes) > 80 IU/l
- Cholesterol > 6.5 mmol/l
- Had suffered a myocardial infarction or stroke in the previous 12 months
- On any lipid-modifying medication
- On any medication affecting blood clotting
- Individuals taking vitamin and/or fish oil supplements

facility.name: Hugh Sinclair Unit of Human Nutrition, University of Reading
